TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a civil claim with ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) against ORG A-CARDINAL for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court decided to discontinue the proceedings as a result of the applicant ’s failure to attend the hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested an extension of time to lodge the appeal against the above ruling and submitted that he had become aware of the impugned ruling in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the ruling of DATE . It remitted the case for examination by the first - instance court , having found that the applicant had not been duly notified of the time and date of the hearings . ORG ruled that the first - instance court had erred in its decision to discontinue the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG considered that it was not competent to deal with the case because it lacked jurisdiction ratione materiae . It discontinued the civil proceedings and held that the case should be examined within the framework of the administrative proceedings .

CARDINAL . Following examination of the applicant ’s appeal on its merits , on DATE ORG quashed the ruling of DATE . It held that the first - instance court had erred in its decision to discontinue the proceedings and considered that the case should be examined within the framework of civil proceedings . ORG remitted the case for examination to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to discontinue the proceedings because of the applicant ’s failure to attend the hearings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the ruling of ORG on the ground that the applicant had not been duly notified of the time and date of the hearings and remitted the case for examination to the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG for the third time decided to discontinue the proceedings because of the applicant ’s repeated failure to attend the hearings . The applicant did not lodge an appeal against that decision .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings QUANTITY hearings were adjourned , out of which CARDINAL times because of the applicant ’s failure to attend the hearings , once because of the failure of the respondent ’s representative and CARDINAL times because of the parties’ failure to attend the hearings .
